items.title: Palo Alto Networks Integrates Vertex AI for Real-Time Threat Analysis
items.description: The cybersecurity giant is migrating its key workloads to Google’s Vertex AI platform to leverage Gemini models for faster automated threat detection and governance.

items.title: Australia Marks Day of Reflection for Bondi Beach Shooting Victims
items.description: Australians are lighting candles to remember victims of a mass shooting at a Jewish festival in Sydney's Bondi Beach.[2]

items.title: US Coast Guard Seizes Second Sanctioned Vessel in Caribbean
items.description: The U.S. Coast Guard interdicted a second sanctioned vessel off Venezuela in the Caribbean Sea, amid pressure on Maduro's regime.[2][4]

items.title: Australian State Plans Tougher Laws Against Extremist Flags After Bondi Shooting
items.description: New South Wales proposes banning public displays of Islamic State flags and extremist symbols following the Bondi incident.[2]

items.title: Pakistani Court Sentences Imran Khan and Wife to 17 Years in Graft Case
items.description: Former PM Imran Khan and Bushra Bibi convicted and sentenced to 17 years in prison for graft.[2]

items.title: UN Urges Rwanda to Leave Eastern Congo, Extends Peacekeeping Mission
items.description: UN Security Council calls for Rwanda's withdrawal from eastern Congo and renews MONUSCO mandate amid M23 offensives.[2][3]

items.title: Russian Strike on Ukraine's Odesa Port Kills at Least 8
items.description: Missile attack on Odesa port infrastructure kills 8 and wounds dozens.[2]

items.title: Trump Administration Restricts Honduran Election Officials' Visas
items.description: Visas restricted for two Honduran officials over interference in special vote count.[2]

items.title: Canada Designates New Terrorist Entities Including IS-Mozambique
items.description: Canada lists 764, Islamic State–Mozambique Province, Terrorgram, and Maniac Murder Cult as terrorist groups.[1]

items.title: Nigeria Grants Asylum to Guinea-Bissau Opposition Leader
items.description: Nigeria shelters Fernando Dias da Costa from military junta detention amid 2025 Guinea-Bissau coup.[1]

items.title: Canada Joins EU's Security Action for Europe Initiative
items.description: Agreement boosts Canadian defense firms' EU market access and European investment in Canada.[1]

items.title: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández Pardoned by Trump
items.description: Hernández released after U.S. pardon for cocaine trafficking conviction.[1]

items.title: Thai Extradition of Vietnamese Human Rights Activist Sparks Concerns
items.description: Thailand hands over Y Quynh Bđăp, founder of ethnic minorities' rights group.[1]

items.title: Nigeria Secures Release of 100 Kidnapped Students in Niger State
items.description: 100 of 315 abducted from school freed; over 160 still missing.[1]

items.title: 13 Suspected Gang Members Killed in Ecuador Prison Riot
items.description: Los Lobos gang members die following explosions in Machala prison.[1]

items.title: Tatmadaw Airstrike on Myanmar Hospital Kills 34
items.description: Strike on hospital in Rakhine State's Mrauk U kills 34, injures 80.[1]

items.title: Iceland Joins Boycott of Eurovision 2026 Over Israel
items.description: Iceland aligns with Ireland, Netherlands, Spain, Slovenia in protesting Israel's participation.[1]

items.title: Philippines Cancels Passport of Flood Control Scandal Suspect
items.description: President Marcos targets Zaldy Co in corruption probe.[1]

items.title: Brazilian Chamber Approves Bill Reducing Coup Penalties for Bolsonaro
items.description: Measure could shorten ex-president's 27-year sentence.[1]

items.title: Vietnam Expands Press Laws to Compel Source Disclosure
items.description: National Assembly amends laws on press and state secrets.[1]

items.title: Belarus Releases 123 Political Prisoners After US Lifts Sanctions
items.description: Includes Nobel laureate Ales Bialiatski and Maria Kalesnikava.[1]

items.title: Guatemala Declares Emergency After Gang Attacks Kill 5
items.description: President Arévalo responds to assaults on military post and police station.[1]

items.title: US Arrests 5 in Far-Left Bomb Plot for New Year's Eve
items.description: Turtle Island Liberation Front members charged with plotting Southern California bombings.[1]
